content:
I apologize for the oversight. Here are two alternative 4-letter words related to cooking to replace "Fry" and "Wok":

1. Skew - As in "skewer," a long, thin metal or wooden stick used to hold pieces of food together, typically for grilling or barbecuing.
2. Sift - A cooking technique that involves passing dry ingredients, like flour, through a sieve to remove any lumps and aerate the mixture.

These words should meet the 4-letter requirement while still being relevant to cooking.
